text: [crying]

Senior Lt. Vasyl Vyshyvanyi
was killed on the eighth day
of the war with Russia.

He was a 28-year-old
paratrooper
with the Ukrainian army.

With heavy fighting
in the Mykolaiv region,

it took five days
to recover his body

and send it home
to his family.

The coffin arrived
sealed shut.
[crying]

The family requested
that Vasyl be buried

in his home village
in western Ukraine.

For miles as the funeral
procession passed,

villagers gathered
at the side of the road
to pay their respects.

After two weeks of government
silence about its death toll,

Ukraine’s president said
around 1,300 soldiers
had been killed,

though that number could not
be independently verified.

Vasyl’s mother still lives in
the house where he grew up.

Vasyl’s grave is in
a small cemetery

near where he was born,
a place far from

the Russian bombing
but still deeply impacted.
